prompt: 建議一個代辦事項應用

context.requirementOutput:
{
  "goals": [
    "設計並開發一個易於使用的代辦事項管理應用",
    "允許用戶有效地管理和追蹤他們的日常任務",
    "支持跨平台使用，包括移動和桌面設備"
  ],
  "constraints": [
    "應用必須在6個月內完成並投入市場",
    "後端服務須使用 RESTful API 架構",
    "前端界面必須適應移動和桌面顯示"
  ],
  "user_roles": [
    "普通用戶：添加、編輯、刪除和查看自己的代辦事項",
    "管理員：管理用戶帳戶和訪問所有用戶的代辦事項"
  ],
  "functional_requirements": [
    "用戶註冊和登錄功能",
    "任務的 CRUD 操作",
    "提供任務分類和優先級設置",
    "支持導出任務數據為 CSV 或 PDF 格式",
    "提供搜索和篩選任務的功能"
  ],
  "non_functional_requirements": [
    "響應時間小於2秒",
    "應用必須支持 HTTPS",
    "系統應保證至少99%的時間可用"
  ]
}

coder_instructions.summary: Set up the initial project structure for a cross-platform to-do list application using Electron.js and Node.js.

directives.do: Create a new directory for the project and initialize a new Node.js project.
directives.why: To establish a foundational project structure that will support both backend and frontend development.

directives.do: Set up an Electron.js application within the project.
directives.why: To provide a framework for creating a cross-platform desktop application.

directives.do: Install necessary NPM packages including express for the RESTful API backend.
directives.why: Express will be used to handle HTTP requests for the backend services.

directives.do: Create a basic RESTful API setup with express to handle CRUD operations for tasks.
directives.why: To provide the backend functionality required for task management.

directives.do: Set up local JSON storage for saving tasks.
directives.why: To meet the storage constraint using local JSON files for simplicity and ease of setup.

directives.do: Implement basic user authentication using JSON files to store user data.
directives.why: To handle user registration and login functionalities as per the functional requirements.

files.purpose: To manage project dependencies and scripts.
To set up the Express server and API routes.
To store user credentials and session information.

acceptance: Project directory 'todo-app' exists with all specified files.
Node.js project is initialized with a package.json file.
Electron and Express are installed and listed in package.json dependencies.

notes: Ensure that the Express server is configured to run both as a standalone API and integrated within Electron for desktop functionality.

output.markdown:
## Task Implementation

You are tasked with setting up the initial project structure for a to-do list application. This includes creating the project directory, initializing a Node.js environment, setting up Electron, installing necessary dependencies, and preparing a basic backend with Express for task management. Follow the detailed instructions and ensure all acceptance criteria are met.
